tweet:
It's Halloween, but want to know what’s actually scary?

Any day now the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals will rule on the GOP healthcare lawsuit—potentially raising costs and ending protections for millions of Michiganders with preexisting health conditions.
To all the Michigan families planning to go trick or treating tonight, I hope the rain holds off and you have a safe (and dry!) Halloween. pic.twitter.com/VQ2XZSTzi8

For Michiganders, the Great Lakes are in our DNA & protecting them needs to be a national priority.

I'm proud to have worked in a bipartisan way to secure a $9 million increase in funding for the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative that passed the Senate.  https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-secures-9-million-increase-in-funding-for-great-lakes-restoration-initiative … pic.twitter.com/Si14TK0ESp

I've long supported efforts to recognize the Armenian genocide that took the lives of over 1.5 million people. I’m glad the House passed a resolution finally taking this overdue step.

I'm proud to cosponsor the Senate version & I urge Senate leaders to bring it to a vote. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1189411626732138496 …
We should be working to improve health care and lowering costs, while ensuring people can afford the health care they need.

I’m voting to overturn the Admin’s policy to let states expand ‘junk insurance’ plans that don’t require insurance companies to protect people with preexisting health conditions or cover necessities like prescription drugs & maternity coverage. https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-stabenow-will-vote-to-stop-expansion-of-health-care-plans-without-protections-for-pre-existing-conditions …

As technology advances, you can’t trust everything you see and hear online.

Glad the Senate approved my bipartisan @HSGAC bill I worked on with @SenRobPortman that will help address the potential threat from deepfakes. pic.twitter.com/2cU3WweJrP

All drivers should know that every time they illegally pass a school bus, they could be placing a student at risk.
 
My bipartisan STOP for School Buses Act will review all current bus safety procedures and look at new technologies to find ways to help keep our children safe. pic.twitter.com/rRrh0o7H9D

Protecting our nation's agricultural industry from disease is crucial to the health & safety of all Michiganders.

I'm pleased my bipartisan bill passed the Senate allowing @CBP to hire more agricultural inspectors at the border. https://twitter.com/HSGAC/status/1187739711248490496 …

Had the opportunity to join @Morning_Joe earlier today to discuss the situation in Syria, including the U.S. military operation that killed ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. pic.twitter.com/1MuWcILma0

Proud to support a bipartisan resolution designating today as #NationalFirstRespondersDay.

We thank our first responders across Michigan and the country who risk their safety and their lives to keep our schools, businesses and communities safe. pic.twitter.com/7P1Q9lfBXD

I joined @TheRevAl on @PoliticsNation to talk about my National Criminal Justice Commission Act.

This long-overdue bill has broad bipartisan support and would reassess our entire criminal justice system, promote more equitable practices & improve public safety. pic.twitter.com/hXnkVwvmWv

While serving in Congress with him, I saw firsthand his dedication and passion for his beloved City of Detroit and the Congressional district he represented.

Colleen and I send our sympathies to the Conyers family during this time.

From being in Selma, Alabama, on Freedom Day during the Civil Rights Movement—to co-founding the Congressional Black Caucus, chairing the @HouseJudiciary Committee and becoming Dean of the House of Representatives—@RepJohnConyers dedicated his life to fighting for civil rights.

A year ago today, 11 Jewish Americans were murdered at the Tree of Life Synagogue.

On this anniversary, I stand with the Jewish community united against hatred & anti-Semitism. Read my thoughts on how Congress can help protect against extremist threats: https://thejewishnews.com/2019/10/24/one-year-after-the-tree-of-life-shooting/ …
Read my statement on the President’s announcement on the U.S. military operation against ISIS in Syria: pic.twitter.com/LMj7tCV86g

Today is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day. There are sites all across Michigan where you can get rid of your expired, unwanted or unused prescription drugs.  https://www.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/drug_disposal/takeback/ …

Michigan autoworkers and their families sacrificed a lot over the past 40 days. I was proud to stand with these workers and join them at the picket lines as they fought for better wages and benefits. https://twitter.com/LSJNews/status/1187844044984111105 …

Tomorrow, Oct. 26 is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day, which provides Michiganders a safe and responsible way to return expired, unwanted or unused prescription drugs.

To find your nearest collection site, visit ⬇️  https://apps.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/NTBI/NTBI-PUB.pub;jsessionid=81B06CE453D1BA712BDC5D076E97E1A9?_flowExecutionKey=_c4E4C3D5A-89D4-1EAC-2E8B-27ED045B0DD1_k09D2C8EF-D006-3EF0-DDED-AE9052823504 …

On my listening tour, I heard from hardworking Michiganders struggling to afford their prescription drugs.
 
No one should have to choose between life-saving medicine or paying the bills. That’s why I’m fighting to lower prescription drug costs for Michigan families. pic.twitter.com/TzljmPk64f

.@BetsyDeVosED turned her back on thousands of Michigan students who were scammed by for-profit colleges.

She should be held accountable for her actions. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1187529221066969088 …
Congratulations to Michigander Roger Penske on receiving this prestigious honor! https://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/2019/10/24/trump-awards-penske-presidential-medal-honor/4082257002/ …

Climate change is not some far off problem—it’s impacting communities across Michigan every day.

I’m working to combat climate change so that our state’s economy and natural resources are safeguarded in the years ahead. https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/michigan/2019/10/21/fall-winter-michigan-lake-level-woes/2278124001/ …

Nearly one year ago, 11 Americans were murdered at the Tree of Life Synagogue in an act of domestic terrorism.
 
There's no place for this kind of bigotry in our country.
 
Read about my bill that aims to protect places of worship in the @JewishNewsDet ⬇️ https://thejewishnews.com/2019/10/24/one-year-after-the-tree-of-life-shooting/ …

I introduced the bipartisan STOP for School Buses Act because no parent should have to worry about their child being injured or possibly losing their life while waiting for or boarding their school bus. pic.twitter.com/9feq50cod7

Too many children are hurt because of reckless drivers around school buses.

As a part of School Bus Safety Week, I highlighted the bipartisan STOP for School Buses Act that I introduced. It’s time for the Senate to act.  https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-colleagues-view-demo-of-school-bus-safety-technology-highlight-stop-for-school-buses-act … pic.twitter.com/DgJJdhJ5H9

Judge Damon Keith was a trailblazer for generations of legal professionals & civil rights activists both in Michigan and across the country.

I was proud to introduce a bill that would award him with the Congressional Gold Medal—the highest civilian honor from Congress. pic.twitter.com/RzavtMtYmB

Congratulations to @WayneState on their commitment to making education more accessible to students in Detroit! https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/detroit-city/2019/10/23/wayne-state-university-pledges-free-tuition-detroit-residents/4071948002/ …

The President’s decision to betray our Kurdish allies in Syria has allowed Russia and Turkey to call the shots. 

What message does this send to anyone wanting to work with us in the future? https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/turkeys-erdogan-meets-with-putin-in-russia-to-discuss-syrian-operation/2019/10/22/764abcea-f43f-11e9-b2d2-1f37c9d82dbb_story.html …

The House passed my bill requiring publicly traded companies to disclose how many jobs they are sending to foreign countries.

I urge my colleagues in the Senate to take up this important legislation.  https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-colleagues-welcome-house-passage-of-outsourcing-accountability-act … pic.twitter.com/hC08DEirLq

The Great Lakes are part of who we are as Michiganders.

That's why I'm introducing an amendment to a government funding bill to increase funding for the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative so we can continue to protect them for future generations. https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-to-introduce-amendment-to-increase-funding-for-great-lakes-restoration-initiative …

Proud to have voted to approve the Republic of North Macedonia’s request to join NATO. This strengthens the transatlantic alliance and is a good step for the US and our partners. https://twitter.com/SenateCloakroom/status/1186687362820128770 …

Congratulations to the members of the Gamma Lambda Chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc., on 100 years of service in the Detroit community.
 
Grateful to have attended their celebration and addressed the attendees at their Gala. pic.twitter.com/1RID6ikfBe

Politicians shouldn’t be able to pick their own voters. Michiganders spoke loud & clear last Nov. that the current redistricting process desperately needs reforming. I hope the 2020 Census will be used to create fairer districts & representation that reflects the will of voters. https://twitter.com/freep/status/1186297109890375680 …

The President should be in the business of doing what’s right for the American people, not directing taxpayer dollars to boost his resorts’ bottom lines.

We need to pass my HOTEL Act to prevent Administration officials from using public funds to line their own pockets. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1185944016669626368 …

Fishing 👍
Phishing 👎
 
October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month, and @CISAgov has tips to avoid online phishing attacks so you and your family can stay safe online.  #BeCyberSmart  https://niccs.us-cert.gov/sites/default/files/documents/pdf/ncsam_phishing_508.pdf?trackDocs=ncsam_phishing_508.pdf …

Throughout Breast Cancer Awareness Month, we recognize the countless women in Michigan and around the country who have battled or are fighting this disease.
 
I stand with all Michiganders who have been impacted by breast cancer and those working to find a cure. https://twitter.com/NBCF/status/1179029454951243776 …

After demanding answers from the White House about the President’s decision to hold the G-7 at his Doral resort, I’m glad he’s reversed course. But it never should have come to this. No taxpayer $ should line the President’s pockets. I’ll keep pushing for passage of my HOTEL Act. https://twitter.com/SenGaryPeters/status/1185592314934317057 …
Thank you @AACCchamber for having me at your annual gala to honor the great Michiganders working to provide more economic opportunity in our state. pic.twitter.com/LDnT64vvYW

Taxpayer dollars shouldn’t be boosting the President's bottom line. But that’s exactly what the President is trying to do by awarding the G-7 Summit to his Doral golf resort. It’s an outrage. The Senate must pass my HOTEL Act. pic.twitter.com/W0z9PplzUr

Good luck to all of the runners participating in the International @FreepMarathon this weekend. Thanks to @CBP and our Canadian partners for helping to facilitate a secure trip across the border and hopefully a few PRs! https://twitter.com/CBPGreatLakes/status/1185285157709926401 …

Governor Milliken’s proud record of bipartisan problem-solving, exemplary public service and love for the Great Lakes defined a Michigan era, and his legacy will continue to inspire Michiganders for generations to come. 

Read my full statement: https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-statement-on-passing-of-governor-milliken …

We’re currently accepting applications for spring 2020 internships in my Michigan and DC offices! These opportunities help students earn valuable work experience, while helping Michiganders.  https://www.peters.senate.gov/services/internships … pic.twitter.com/jlk22IP5mH

I’m outraged by the President’s decision to host the 2020 G-7 Summit at his Doral golf resort. The President should not use his office to funnel American taxpayer dollars to boost his personal bottom line. 

As Ranking Member of @HSGAC I’m demanding answers about this decision. pic.twitter.com/rV3gka07bA

Excited that Michigander @Astro_Christina is taking part in the first ever all-female spacewalk! Christina and her fellow astronauts are leading the way and inspiring women across the world. 🚀🌎 https://www.npr.org/2019/10/16/770743547/nasas-first-all-female-spacewalk-set-for-friday …

🚨🚨🚨The President is using his position to line his pockets by directing taxpayer dollars to his resort.

The skills gap will grow without more training opportunities. I hear about this often across our state. I got bipartisan provisions signed into law by President Trump to expand career & technical education pathways outside of a 4-year degree & will keep working on this issue. https://twitter.com/reporterdavidj/status/1184472191108337664 …

.@RepCummings was an extraordinary and fearless leader, who spoke truth to power and fought tirelessly for his constituents and all Americans. Chairman Cummings will be deeply missed, and his passing is a big loss for our country.

Building revolutionary vehicles has defined not only Michigan, but all of America, powering both our economy and our daily lives. That’s why @senrobportman & I want to document automotive innovation with a dedicated central register.

More from @freep ⬇️ https://www.freep.com/story/money/cars/mark-phelan/2019/10/12/historic-vehicles-national-register-gary-peters-rob-portman/3947606002/ …
Proud to have the support of @NAACP, @NAPOpolice, @NationalAction, @MjrCitiesChiefs, @MIPOAM, @NAtUrbanLeague & others in this effort.

There hasn’t been a review of our criminal justice system in over 50 years. That must change.

My bipartisan bill would create a National Criminal Justice Commission to reassess our entire system, promote more equitable practices & improve public safety. https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-graham-cornyn-announce-reintroduction-of-bipartisan-national-criminal-justice-commission-act …

The past 31 days have been a difficult time of sacrifice for striking auto workers and their families. I’m proud they stood firm in the fight for better wages and benefits. I’m glad that GM and the UAW have reached a tentative agreement, and I look forward to seeing details.

It's unacceptable that @BetsyDeVosED has proposed to gut protections for thousands of Michigan students seeking debt relief who were defrauded by for-profit colleges.

@SenStabenow & I are urging DeVos to undo this proposal & stand with Michigan students. https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-stabenow-call-on-secretary-devos-to-undo-rule-that-guts-protections-for-defrauded-students …

Is your password still ‘password’?

It’s Cybersecurity Awareness Month, so take some time to make sure you and your family are being safe online. Check out some tips from @CISAgov on how to create a strong password.  https://niccs.us-cert.gov/sites/default/files/documents/pdf/ncsam_creatingapassword_508.pdf?trackDocs=ncsam_creatingapassword_508.pdf …

It’s unacceptable for Michiganders to have to choose between their life-saving medicines and other essential expenses. I’ll continue working to cut prescription drug costs.
 
More from @WNEMTV5news ⬇️ pic.twitter.com/TThuG6wTL9

For 244 years, the @USNavy has defended our freedom & way of life.

As a former Lt. Commander in the Navy Reserve, I join Americans everywhere in thanking our servicemembers & their families for their service. It was an honor to have attended this year’s Motor City Navy Ball. pic.twitter.com/YnIeF8EUii

There is no place for anti-semitism in Grand Rapids, our state or our country. We stand united in condemning intolerance, hate and evil in all its forms. https://www.michiganadvance.com/2019/10/13/grand-rapids-jewish-temple-hit-with-anti-semitic-graffiti/ …

Don’t know a farmer to thank on #NationalFarmersDay? 

This is Jim who is a 4th generation apple farmer in Sparta, MI. Thanks for all your hard work, Jim! pic.twitter.com/MPQjQifO8h
Today we thank all our Michigan farmers who work from sunrise to sunset to feed our families & drive our economy. #NationalFarmersDay

When we work together, we can ensure that people of all faiths are treated with dignity and respect. 
 
I was honored to attend the @mimuslimcouncil’s Annual Unity Gala. This organization’s dedication to solving complex issues within the Muslim community is vital to Michigan. pic.twitter.com/gRLwJE37ZF

At our final prescription drug listening session in Flint, I heard from hardworking Michiganders on how rising prescription drug costs have impacted their lives. I’ll continue working to bring these costs down. pic.twitter.com/CDo1uYfwcm

Spent the morning in Flint with local health providers & families, discussing the personal toll of rising prescription drugs prices.
 
I’ll continue fighting in Washington to lower health care costs because no Michigander should have to struggle to get the medicine they need. pic.twitter.com/5WVDDJ0dbP

Rachael from West Michigan has to travel to Canada to get insulin for her three diabetic children at a price her family can afford. This is unacceptable. That’s why I’m working to reduce the costs of prescription drugs. pic.twitter.com/WsMyvAduAN

In Southgate I heard from Sheron who is a breast cancer survivor and living with a rare condition called Sarcoidosis. The price of her prescription drugs are unaffordable, yet she needs them to live. I’ll keep fighting for Michiganders like Sheron to bring these costs down. pic.twitter.com/qGCdqVp5Cd
Thank you to everyone who joined me in Southgate at my listening session and shared how skyrocketing prescription drug costs have affected their daily lives. pic.twitter.com/hsXmoPQIet

The President’s decision to abandon our Kurdish allies in Syria is a huge mistake. It harms our national security and paves the way for ISIS’ resurgence.
Turning our backs on our allies that took the fight to ISIS sends a dangerous signal to those wanting to work with us. pic.twitter.com/Qdnq2Nbjj1

#WorldMentalHealthDay serves as an important reminder of the need to fight stigmas surrounding mental illness.
 
If you think a friend or loved one needs help, reach out and help them get the care they need.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy. Had the chance to meet with the Rotary Club of Portage today to discuss how we can continue supporting small business owners and innovative entrepreneurs. pic.twitter.com/CphBkn1TcK

I’m focused on working to reduce health care and prescription drug costs & address drug shortages because every Michigander should have access to the treatment they need.
 
Thank you to everyone who shared their story with me at my listening roundtable in Grand Rapids. pic.twitter.com/I2YbMZ7XVt

Michiganders shouldn’t ever have to choose between the getting medicine they need or paying the bills.
 
Today I’m hearing from community members in Grand Rapids as I kick off of my listening tour on cutting prescription drug costs. pic.twitter.com/PVw352jhtz

Schools, businesses & families across Michigan depend on strong cybersecurity to protect their information from hackers.
 
Today I spoke at the Michigan Cybersecurity Conference on ways we can address cybersecurity threats. pic.twitter.com/TzY0QpIkUf

The President’s decision in Syria cripples our Kurdish partners’ ability to keep thousands of ISIS prisoners in prison camps.
 
As a member of @SASCDems, I know it also undermines our ability to work with allies to keep us safe.
 
Watch more, via @Morning_Joe ⬇ pic.twitter.com/wAkkheW1vh

Sending best wishes to everyone in Michigan and around the country observing Yom Kippur.
 
May you have an easy and meaningful fast.

This week I’ll be hearing from community members, health care providers & medical professionals across Michigan on how they’ve been impacted by skyrocketing prescription drug prices. pic.twitter.com/wH6BspdN8N

Saturday, October 12 my office and @RepStevens’ office will co-host an informational event in Wixom for high school students interested in attending military academies. Make sure to stop by!
 https://www.facebook.com/events/430479640922568/ …

The President’s decision regarding Syria harms our national security, abandons our strategic partners and sends the wrong message to persecuted minorities that see our country as a beacon of hope and freedom.

I serve on the Senate Armed Services Committee and I can tell you—ISIS has NOT been eliminated. This is an irresponsible plan that could reverse our progress against ISIS and give terrorists committed to hurting us an opportunity to regroup.

This Mental Illness Awareness Week, we recommit ourselves to encourage advocacy in the face of harmful stigmas.

If you or a loved one needs help, please call @800273TALK for the 24-hour suicide hotline.

How many Senators objected to my resolution calling for the final national defense bill to require the @DeptofDefense to phase out firefighting foams with PFAS?

0.

We agree that we must protect our troops, firefighters & communities from exposure to these toxic chemicals.

Most people can tell you about a teacher they had who changed their life forever.
 
On World Teacher Day, we thank the thousands of teachers in Michigan and across the nation that help shape brighter futures every day. pic.twitter.com/OqX5lPIaxA

I urged the Administration to protect Michiganders from health insurance plans that discriminate against people with pre-existing health conditions.

 https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-stabenow-urge-trump-administration-to-protect-michiganders-with-preexisting-health-conditions … pic.twitter.com/1nJrpBk1lj
This would bring all of our manufacturing programs under one roof & streamline government while benefiting our economy & strengthening our national security.
We need to make U.S. manufacturing a greater priority & have a national strategy. That's why I proposed creating a National Institute of Manufacturing.

We're from Michigan. We know how to make stuff. From the Model T to the Arsenal of Democracy, we have continually forged revolutionary innovation.

On Manufacturing Day, we honor the generations of workers who made and continue to make our state a powerhouse. pic.twitter.com/QjV8rCaEk5

🚨 Starting October 2020, Michiganders will need a REAL ID-compliant document in order to board domestic flights & enter certain federal facilities. 

Click here for more info:  https://www.michigan.gov/REALID  https://twitter.com/wzzm13/status/1179147745925517320 …
But there's still more work to do. I'm going to continue pressing for further action so we can protect the Great Lakes for future generations.

A pipeline spill in the Great Lakes would be catastrophic for Michigan & the country. Glad @PHMSA_DOT announced rules to enhance pipeline safety, which are being implemented as a result of provisions that I got signed into law. https://www.peters.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/peters-encouraged-by-new-pipeline-safety-rules-finalized-as-a-result-of-legislation-he-authored …

We face cybersecurity challenges at every level—from the federal government to our own personal devices.
 
Glad I could stop by the workshop hosted by @cybersupportnet at the Williamston Senior Center where folks learned some simple ways to stay safe online. pic.twitter.com/pUELkoWS36

The Great Lakes Restoration Initiative helps:
💧clean waterways
🐢restore habitats
🐟combat invasive species
🗑prevent pollution
 
We need to expand this program to help preserve our Great Lakes for future generations of Michiganders.

Today I walked the picket line with striking auto workers at the Lansing Grand River Assembly.

When the industry was in crisis, these Michiganders stepped up in the spirit of shared sacrifice. During times of profitability, our auto workers deserve to share in the prosperity. pic.twitter.com/ZBZwapxHdE
Thanks for having me! https://twitter.com/LansingChamber/status/1179017646253187075 …

Had the chance to address the @LansingChamber this morning to discuss how we can continue supporting Michigan small businesses and manufacturing, while strengthening our national security. pic.twitter.com/urSrYXZVy2

This ruling upholding the FCC’s repeal of net neutrality is a setback in the fight to ensure a free and open internet nationally.

Michiganders rely on dependable, open internet access every day & I'll keep fighting to restore #NetNeutrality protections. https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/01/appeals-court-upholds-trump-administrations-cancelling-net-neutrality-rules/ …
